response: narrative=Rhys Martin, a thirteen-year-old listed as a medium-risk missing person, was reported missing from his home in Rosyth. Having been recently discharged from a care facility and having recently had his LGBTQ+ identity outed, Rhys left without leaving a note. His disappearance puzzled his friend Garry and his colleague Elaine O'Neill. The search intensified around Limekilns Road, Dunfermline, and St Margaret's Head, North Queensferry, adding urgency due to the suburban areas surrounded by stretches of desert-like terrain. After days of concern, Rhys was traced by police to the suburban address of 6-9 West Green in Crail. The circumstances surrounding his departure remain unclear, sparking discussions among his friends and colleagues about the challenges he faced with his foster placement and personal struggles.
narrative=Rhys, recently outed, vanished post music lessons in suburban Leargan. His foster mother, Jennifer, was worried sick.
narrative=Rhys Martin vanished from 43 Findlay Street, Rosyth. Fearful of deportation, he left no note. A friend spotted him at 54 Nethergate South, Crail, near a suburban grocery store.

narrative=Rhys Martin was last seen leaving a grocery store on Pitreavie Drive, Dunfermline. Having been recently discharged from a rehab center and recently outed as LGBTQ+, Rhys was navigating a challenging personal landscape. He left behind no note before disappearing. His friend, Gordon Nicholls, became concerned and contacted authorities after failing to reach him that day. Situated in a suburban neighborhood, the area was familiar to Rhys, as well as the nearby arcade and gym. After several hours of searching, police found Rhys at 23 Norval Place, Rosyth, known to be a spot where he often visited to find some solitude.

narrative=Rhys Martin, a 15-year-old recently discharged from a care facility, was reported missing from his foster home at 43 Findlay Street, Rosyth. Prior interactions with Janet Faulkner, a colleague from his care team, highlighted concerns about his adjustment post-discharge. Initial leads suggested Rhys might have wandered towards the suburban area of 7 Dollar Grove, Burntisland, possibly seeking solace away from the familiar turmoil. His friend Nicholas Butler noted Rhys’s fascination with solitary landscapes, hinting at the possibility of him venturing into adjacent desert-like areas. With high risk concerns, authorities initiated an extensive search. Rhys was eventually traced by a member of the public at 6-9 West Green, Crail, safely returning him to care.

narrative=Rhys Martin, a 15-year-old under foster care, was last seen at a shopping mall near 18-21 Mellor Court, Rosyth. Known for occasionally venturing into secluded areas, he was reported missing after failing to return home. Concerns were raised due to past mentions of seeking solitude in the desert-like outskirts beyond Rosyth. His foster father noted recent conversations about a particular suburban summer camp, known for its proximity to quiet desert trails. After an extensive search involving police and outreach to his colleague Janet Faulkner, Rhys was found safe at a friend's residence on Backmarch Crescent, Rosyth.
narrative=Rhys Martin, recently discharged from a care facility and outed as LGBTQ+, was last seen at a lake near 12 Selvage Street, Rosyth, with a colleague from his part-time job.
narrative=Rhys Martin was last seen leaving a suburban grocery store. His foster mother, Jennifer Kelly, alerted the rehab center.
